Description: Context isolation prevents renderer from accessing Node.js
Do: contextIsolation: true in BrowserWindow webPreferences

Description: Expose safe APIs via preload contextBridge
Do: contextBridge.exposeInMainWorld for safe API exposure

Description: Renderer should not have direct Node.js access
Do: nodeIntegration: false (default in modern Electron)

Description: Validate all data received via IPC in main process
Do: Type-check and sanitize IPC handler arguments
Code Good: ipcMain.handle('read-file' (event path) => { if (!isAllowedPath(path)) throw new Error('forbidden') })

Description: Sandbox renderer processes for defense in depth
Do: sandbox: true in webPreferences (default in v20+)

Description: Request-response pattern with promises
Do: handle/invoke for async communication

Description: Send minimal data over IPC for performance
Do: Send IDs or small payloads then fetch in main
Don't: Sending large objects or binary over IPC

Description: Use TypeScript types for IPC channel contracts
Do: Typed channel names and payload types

Description: Set appropriate window options for platform
Do: Show window after ready-to-show event
Code Good: const win = new BrowserWindow({show: false}); win.once('ready-to-show' () => win.show())
Code Bad: const win = new BrowserWindow({}) /* white flash */

Description: Handle multi-window architecture cleanly
Do: Track windows in a Map with lifecycle management
Code Good: const windows = new Map(); function createWindow(id) { ... }
Code Bad: let mainWindow = null /* single window only */

Description: Persist and restore window position and size
Do: Save bounds on close restore on create
Code Good: const bounds = store.get('windowBounds'); win = new BrowserWindow(bounds)
Code Bad: new BrowserWindow({ width: 1200 height: 800 }) /* always same */

Description: Native application menu for platform consistency
Do: Menu.buildFromTemplate with platform-aware items
Don't: No application menu or web-only hamburger menu
Code Bad: /* No native menu - custom HTML menu only */

Description: Right-click context menus for desktop experience
Do: electron-context-menu or Menu.popup for context menus
Don't: No right-click support in desktop app

Description: Add tray icon for background apps
Do: Tray with context menu and notification badges
Don't: Running without tray icon for background apps
Code Bad: /* No tray icon for app that runs in background */

Description: Persist user preferences and app state
Do: electron-store or custom JSON file in userData
Code Good: const Store = require('electron-store'); const store = new Store()

Description: Use proper OS directories for file storage
Do: app.getPath('userData') app.getPath('documents')

Description: Implement automatic updates for distribution
Do: electron-updater with code signing
Don't: No update mechanism or manual downloads only

Description: Inform users about update progress
Do: Show download progress and restart prompt

Description: Create windows only when needed
Do: Create secondary windows on demand
Code Good: function openSettings() { if (!settingsWindow) settingsWindow = new BrowserWindow(...) }

Description: Offload heavy computation from renderer main thread
Do: Web Workers for data processing parsing and computation
Don't: Heavy computation in renderer main thread
Code Bad: /* Processing 10MB JSON in renderer main thread */

Description: Minimize time to first meaningful paint
Do: Defer non-essential module loading + show splash screen
Don't: Loading all modules synchronously at startup

Description: Native OS dialogs for file operations
Do: dialog.showOpenDialog dialog.showSaveDialog
Don't: Custom HTML dialogs for file operations

Description: OS-native notifications for user alerts
Do: new Notification({ title body }) for system notifications
Don't: Custom toast UI for system-level alerts
Code Good: new Notification({ title: 'Update' body: 'New version available' })
Code Bad: /* Custom HTML toast for critical system notification */

Description: Native file drag and drop
Do: webContents.startDrag for dragging from app / ondrop for receiving
Don't: No drag and drop support in desktop app
Code Bad: /* No file drop zone in desktop app */

Description: Production build and packaging toolchain
Do: @electron-forge/cli or electron-builder for packaging

Description: Sign application for distribution
Do: Code sign for both macOS and Windows

Description: Handle OS differences gracefully
Do: process.platform checks for OS-specific behavior
Don't: Assuming all users are on same OS

Description: E2E testing for Electron apps
Do: Playwright with electron fixture for E2E tests

Description: Register global and local keyboard shortcuts
Do: globalShortcut.register and accelerator in Menu

Description: Ensure content is accessible to screen readers
Do: Semantic HTML and ARIA attributes in renderer

Description: Handle custom URL protocol for deep linking
Do: app.setAsDefaultProtocolClient for custom protocol
